website_summaries.verdict: A compact and portable weather radio that is perfect for camping trips.
pros: The backlight on this radio switches from blue to red when there is an alert, making it easy to identify when a hazardous weather situation is approaching
The built-in flashlight comes in handy on camping trips or during power outages
cons: This unit can go through batteries fairly quickly, so it is best when used with an adapter (sold separately)

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: It Eats Batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a sensitive, nicely laid out and sturdy radio that does a fine job of picking up signals on all bands. HOWEVER, it eats batteries alive! I put it on standby to monitor for weather emergency alerts and the Eneloop batteries discharge within a day! This is poor design electronically. Monitoring for the weather alerts shouldn't take that much power. The speaker, the big energy hog in these kinds of radios, is muted; the light is off. I even tried the high-end lithium batteries, and they were gone in a few days. So unless you have a six volt wall wart that fits this unit, be prepared to constantly replace/recharge batteries if you are in weather alert standby mode....
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio, so great I ordered another one. My husband wanted something to listen to while he was at work. I purchased this one and he loves it. I purchased the second one for my MIL because she wanted a weather radio and she also loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Jones

customer_reviews.title: It failed
customer_reviews.text: Failed..easily..seemed to be ok for what little I had it .few days at best. I would say s solid 3 if it would of not melted down..or almost melted down over heating took it down for only 5.volts it sure did heat up almost as bad as a 9 to 12 volt .battery fail ..now when I say I would have gave it a 3 but thats because there r no more 5 star weather radios out any there any more ....almost all weather radios have something most of the serious radio guy that we don't like about there design. But for most will and would ever know that ..
customer_reviews.author: james morris

customer_reviews.title: ... season and wanted a radio to alert me of bad weather since I typically listen to books while I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was about to start on a cross country road trip during tornado season and wanted a radio to alert me of bad weather since I typically listen to books while I drive. The unit that I received would turn on but did not get any stations on any band. Returned for a credit and bought a Midland portable alert radio which works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: beechridge

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste
customer_reviews.text: No redeeming quality for this radio. It doesn't get AM, FM, or weather stations when I'm right here in town, leave town and you can forget about it. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. Hoskinson

customer_reviews.title: Jamming in the woods, while fishing, camping...I love this
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my buddy's La Crosse Super Sport Radio for the past year and finally decided to just buy my own. My jealous days of playing 80's love rock ballads to the fish are over as I can do it on my own now. It's light enough to take backpacking as a small luxury and the battery life easily lasts through a weekend making it worth the slight additional weight. I'm just glad I finally have my own
customer_reviews.author: Darth Hoff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Delivery fast. Perfect just what I wanted. Perfect for camping and backpacking sound is clear. I live in the country and this radio being I was in the garage picked up the closes weather station all my favorite FM and AM radio stations with strong frequency and sound very impressed. Love the led light. Very sturdy, well made a must have radio and weather radio for the camper, hiker, biker, or any other outdoor activities you do, which I do them all. Will be buying another one for my girlfriend. Love the weather alert Thanks great product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very poor AM reception.
customer_reviews.text: In my area (the San Fernando Valley part of Los Angeles), AM reception is extremely poor. It's not that I'm in an area far from local stations, as every other radio I have works better. FM is marginal. The weather band, though, does come in OK, if that's all you need. I'll keep the radio just for the weather band, but I wouldn't buy it again if it dies, and I wouldn't recommend it to others. Two stars just for the radio receiving the weather, otherwise I would give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: El Berto

customer_reviews.title: Just an okay radio
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking radio. Overall it works well but doesn't pull in stations from very far away. I live in Sacramento and listen to talk radio a lot (AM stations mainly) and like some Bay Area stations too. I have had like radios in the past that have been able to pull in these stations but this radio doesn't seem to be able to. Given this is also weather radio you would think it better than average reception. If you are looking for a nice looking radio and only listen your local stations this will suffice for you. I give it an average rating at best.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Winters

customer_reviews.title: Great for my RV
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio to be in my RV during my travels. So far it has had great sound, good reception and has held up well. I like it size - as it can be stashed in a cabinet or drawer. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ann-Marie Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Bad reception
customer_reviews.text: AM radio reception is practically zero. FM and weather band reception is fair to poor. It doesn't come with an A/C adapter. I wound up throwing it away. It receives poorly in the middle of the city.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an older radio that passed away. I like it a lot....looks good, sounds good, and grabs the NWS channel firmly. Since I am in a metro area, I don't need to use the telescoping antenna. Anyway, I am not at all sorry that I bought this radio!
customer_reviews.author: Mousehouse1950

customer_reviews.title: Second thoughts !
customer_reviews.text: Strange but I tried to cancel this order within minutes of ordering which is usually not a problem ! Cant say much for the quality nor the sound or the reception ! Can say I will make a better choice next time but might pawn it off at a yard sale for $5.00 as is !
customer_reviews.author: Charlie D.

customer_reviews.title: Value Product
customer_reviews.text: High quality audio, ok quality build that is understandable for the price. Excellent battery life, runs for days on end without needing battery replacement. Reception is very good with the extendable antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Lawliet L.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed !!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly disappointed . I bought this for my husband for Father's Day. It seemed to work OK at the time. He wanted to use it today to listen to the game, and it did not work. He can only Listen to FM and cannot control the volume at all. And since I researched the item well in advance, the return window is closed.
customer_reviews.author: KBrady

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to use a small portable radio, make sure you get electronic tuning. This radio has it and it works great, pulling in the FM stations I wish to listen to within a 40 mile range. Earphones are not provided but it doesn't matter, everyone has earphones already. Also receives 3 different NOAA weather stations in my region. Tuning is a little cumbersome (must push "UP" or "DOWN" arrow to find correct frequency) but that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good brand poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Now that we have had this radio for some time, I need to re-adjust my review. Bought this radio as we live in a rural area and often have strong storms and even cyclones. When we first used our little radio, it seemed that it would at least pick up a few stations, now if you are lucky enough to pick up one station, you cannot hear it! Volume is horrible. Don't waste your money on this radio! Neighbor has a Midland and three times the quality.
customer_reviews.author: crackshot

customer_reviews.title: La Crosse 810-805 NOAA Weather Radio
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good, a little week on reception in the AM range, okay for the Weather Stations, seems the aerial is not quit matched to the input stage, better reception touching the aerial "just so." I does have some other good features but I miss the Thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: OBH

customer_reviews.title: Good solid little receiver.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because we live in earthquake country and I wanted something for my emergency kit. It works well, is small enough to carry but not so small you're going to lose it. Honestly, I hope it never comes out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: mhogan

customer_reviews.title: I loved it last month when I first received it
customer_reviews.text: I loved it last month when I first received it. It was easy to use, had a nice sound for a small radio, and I especially liked the weather band. However, after a few weeks, the MODE button stopped working and is stuck on the FM band - no AM, no Weather. Pity. I'm not even sure it is worth returning it for another one. Maybe I just got a lemon. It seemed like a nice little radio, otherwise. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: urabus

customer_reviews.title: always works
customer_reviews.text: this weather radio is a life saver I have had it for 3 years and I live in Florida and have had multiple hurricanes and storms I was flooded in Irma and this was the only few things that lasted
customer_reviews.author: john taylor

customer_reviews.title: LaCrosse weather radio
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio! It's perfect for what I need it for. NOT thrilled about having to reset the stations every time I change the batteries so I recommend getting the cord and battery use for when the power does go out. Other than that, it's a great little radio.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Nice radio. I own two
customer_reviews.text: Nice radio. I own two. The antenna top on one broke off already with minimal use. I have to be careful not to push the antenna too far closed or it could be tough to pull back out next time. Sound is nothing special, small speaker. Reception is ok, typical of any weather radio.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pocket weather radio
customer_reviews.text: It’s a weather pocket radio. Works just as it should. Sounds just as it should. Great for any emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Billsreview

customer_reviews.title: NOAA Weather Alert setting kills battery, and AC adapter causes static.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased product mainly for NOAA weather and emergency alerts. Radio is on when in mode to receive alerts so 3 AA batteries last a few days, less than a week. I also purchased the AC adapter but when it is plugged in it causes reception static making it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby's stocking and he's not been without it. He loves radios separate from tech so he's not interrupted. This portable radio is great. Great sound very clear on even am channels and very bright flashlight. Great for everyday use or throw it on your glovebox or camping gear.
customer_reviews.author: KiraNyres

customer_reviews.title: Excellent weather radio
customer_reviews.text: Superb design. Great alert system. The am/fm is nice to have, but I wasn't expecting much, as I am only interested primarily in the weather band. I've owned other products from La Crosse, and have been very satisfied. The reception on the weather band is really good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headphone jack failed
customer_reviews.text: nice design but seemed somewhat cheaply made. Headphone jack failed 2nd day, returned. At least it failed quickly. Digital tuner moves very slowly, bad combination with no presets.
customer_reviews.author: Thayer

customer_reviews.title: It looks nice, solid
customer_reviews.text: The radio came in the mail on time. It looks nice, solid. All features such as flashlight, red alert signal, digital tuning for am,fm work but a lot of static comes on AM stations to make it hard to enjoy the listening. You have to keep it facing at one direction to have good signal with some static interference therefore if you put the radio in your pocket and walk around, you cannot use the radio!! Too bad, I have no choice but send it back.
customer_reviews.author: danwynn

customer_reviews.title: Nice little device !
customer_reviews.text: Nice little device ! Bought this for my mom as she loves to listen to the news while she walks ! The flashlight feature is a big PLUS as she likes to walk her dog at night !
customer_reviews.author: Jesse R.

customer_reviews.title: Local stations came in great, and I had no trouble finding a weather ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the adapter separately from La Crosse. The radio also runs on batteries, of course. Local stations came in great, and I had no trouble finding a weather band that came in well. I meant to buy one of those crank and solar power radios, but the cranks didn't get good ratings and the solar panels weren't very effective. So I decided to keep it simple.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisie T

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money...
customer_reviews.text: I had a different radio previously that died. This one didn't even make it through 1 storm. Radio has an extendible antenna that doesn't work well under my pillow at night (like my previous radio). I set it on my night stand and the brand new batteries were dead by morning, twice... Time to go back to the one I bought previously.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wuennenberg

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality and portability. Throw in your pocket, and go!
customer_reviews.author: Bert Allen

customer_reviews.title: does not work as a fm radio
customer_reviews.text: Gets wewther channels, but all other channels do not come in clearly.
customer_reviews.author: David Russell

customer_reviews.title: It even has a flashlight
customer_reviews.text: This is recommend it, well made, and very useful, with memory settings. Battery Operated, No Hand Crank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a lot of severe weather in Middle Tennessee but this works very well, when needed. The AM/FM Radio has good reception. Sometimes I use it when I want to listen to NPR in the house. I highly recommend La Crosse.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing. It's old school, but I like it that way. I keep it on the weather channel, and when I turn it on, I have the weather news within 2 minutes. It has AM, FM and weather, and it's a nice little radio for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much the same as the old transistor radios that ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Volume is adequate and signal strength is fair. Pretty much the same as the old transistor radios that I used to have 40 years ago. Weather radio is a plus, but the radio has to be on and on the NOAA channel to receive the alerts. Not disappointed with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool to have you don't have to sit there ...
customer_reviews.text: I live in Oklahoma so I know storms. This is a great tool to have you don't have to sit there and listen to the babble all day long. Push and hold turns the red light on. And when you have an emergency it will wake you up. It does get your attention so you can respond..... absolutely fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Brad S.

customer_reviews.title: Good a little radio
customer_reviews.text: This little radio sounds good and feels solid. It is small enough to fit in the pocket of a rain slicker and the buttons are large and distinctive enough that this will be easy to work with wet hands. My only gripe is that it does not have a battery level warning. So, plan on checking the batteries manually in hurricane/storm season.
customer_reviews.author: I Teach Typing

customer_reviews.title: Going strong 2 years in.
customer_reviews.text: Had this for 2 years and use it in my truck and storm cellar.
customer_reviews.author: CSK

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio that I take to the beach. Great sound and also very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Hate it
customer_reviews.text: The first time I tried to use it during a tornado watch it didn't work at all Did not come with a connection for power
customer_reviews.author: torre

customer_reviews.title: that came really fast in the mail but this one doesn't work like I wanted it
customer_reviews.text: Volume buttons don't work and the channel changes if you touch it even lightly. Then you have to go through all the channels to get back to the channel you want to listen too. The first one I ordered was broke, Amazon sent me a new one, that came really fast in the mail but this one doesn't work like I wanted it too
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Francis

customer_reviews.title: Weather-AM-FM radio
customer_reviews.text: It has a clear projection of sound. I'm happy with it so far. Haven't had any spring storms yet but I'm confident it will be great.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Benedict

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio!
customer_reviews.text: I love this radio. Very functional, very compact, and easy on the batteries. I hasn't suffered any crazy accidents yet, but it's enduring day-to-day wear beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible reception. Had to prop it in my bathroom ...
customer_reviews.text: Terrible reception. Had to prop it in my bathroom window was the only place in the house that it could get a signal. Went thru batteries fast. Bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sassypugmom

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane season
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weather radio for hurricane season. I use it all the time, this little radio really is a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe garica

customer_reviews.title: Nice emergency radio.
customer_reviews.text: Great radio. Decent flashlight, and all the channels come out nice and clear. You get AM & FM.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Not factory tested?
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work,no sound on any channels AM, FM, or NOAA not even static. Flashlight worked , blue backlite came on but that's it. Seems of overall poor quality, note it's made in china, buttons aren't very user friendly. Will be returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dale J.

customer_reviews.title: did not work as expected, it wasn't powerful enough ...
customer_reviews.text: did not work as expected, it wasn't powerful enough to pull in my normal channels. not sure if it was defective. I had to return item
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Good radio, good value.
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio, going in an emergency kit but I’m sure I’ll use it around the house. Picks up any station I’ve tried. NOAA works nice and clear. I also got a Motorola Atmos 800 for backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Meinhardt

customer_reviews.title: Very nice radio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically to use when I go to the drive ins so that I don't need to leave my car running. Has nice reception and tunes easily. I really like the flashlight too; it has two brightness settings.
customer_reviews.author: Kaelyn

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Solid radio for the price. Digital tuning works perfectly. Antenna efficient. Able to tune in to my favorite channels.
customer_reviews.author: King Salmon

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great little radio. Can tune in to 2-3 NOAA channels, depending on the weather, etc. FM radio reception/sound is good with antenna up. My only disappointment was with the AM stations. Reception is poor and far too much background noise to listen to. To be fair, I live off-grid far out in the woods and in the hills, so can't expect miracles. I bought it primarily for the weather radio, so... Also like the built-in flashlight, which is brighter than expected and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Norwood

customer_reviews.title: this has got to be the best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I have had many weather radios. this has got to be the best one yet. only complaint customer service not good. called and coluld not talk to any one. I had to leave my number and got a call back two days later. Also warranty policy is not good
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Nice weather alert, but it drains batteries weekly. Expensive to keep running.
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking unit, but it goes through batteries each week. Would like to have an adapter for it so we could plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. Smaller than I was expecting, but good sound like everyone says. I keep it on standby, but haven't gotten an alert yet. Am looking forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: VERDEXIPHLUX

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed didn’t work all that great the only reason I gave it one star is ...
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed didn’t work all that great the only reason I gave it one star is it wouldn’t let me go zero.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great reception.  Nice mobile weather radio.
customer_reviews.text: Great reception. Perfect size for me as a mobile weather radio.
customer_reviews.author: Bloomtown

customer_reviews.title: Works well,
customer_reviews.text: Works well, much smaller than it looks in picture about the size of the old am portable radio from the sixty
customer_reviews.author: Dave Moffat

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working 5 days After Return Policy Expired !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this radio on July 16 and was initially pleased. By August 21 the button used to change bands and the volume buttons had stopped working completely. The radio is stuck on the FM band and you can't change the volume. Wanted to exchange it for a new one and was informed it was past the 30 day return policy. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Charles F.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For the money it is good. Radio and light work great. Weather band is good also.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light. Perfect for a Go bag or even a regular EDC. Weather band works well, as does AM/FM. The display is clear and bright. The antenna can be extended.
customer_reviews.author: Lannister

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio..I have had it over 1 1/2 and I love it, good sound and durable..way better than the last cheap Grundig I had.
customer_reviews.author: david coelho

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this little machine, has great sound and is very protable
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a great little radio
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little radio. Very sturdy, good sound. With all the stormy weather in Tx, comes in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: charly66

customer_reviews.title: only worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: When I got it worked fine. But I bought it for camping, the beach, etc. Well, after about a year later, the radio just stopped working. I guess the life span for this device is only a year. Beat.
customer_reviews.author: talos4

customer_reviews.title: Little, but good
customer_reviews.text: Handy little radio - fits in my tackle box - when I take the kids out, I know if a storm is coming, or the clouds are staying put!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W. Hale

customer_reviews.title: OK for weather band only.
customer_reviews.text: Great for weather, but forget reception and sound quality for AM or FM. My 1960's transistor had better sound quality and reception.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t see display!!! Don’t buy this! Overpriced waste of money
customer_reviews.author: LeEbah

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: nice one but expensive to what offers. Should've come with a dc outlet charger.
customer_reviews.author: Rogério Assad Dias

customer_reviews.title: This has great sound and I love it
customer_reviews.text: I just got this radio. I have tinnitis and have to sleep with one plugged into one ear. This has great sound and I love it.!!!! I think I'll order another one, as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: karolyn m hesketh

customer_reviews.title: Works well, built well, excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Works well, built well, excellent value. Sweet little radio. Only used it once so far at home and reception and clarity were excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Goat

customer_reviews.title: durable radio
customer_reviews.text: It fell in my pool and went to the bottom. After it dried out the radio worked fine. Then it happened again. Radio was never quite the same.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good radio for preparedness, or for when doing yardwork.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound and reception. Very simple radio but gets the job done for not much money. I thought the flashlight was a gimmick, but it has turned out t be useful. The casing is pretty rugged.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: Don't Count on It
customer_reviews.text: This was a very disappointing purchase. The unit has a great feature set and ergonomic design, but it is all for nothing because of its poor performance as a radio. The AM band is full of squeaks and squeals from the poor internal shielding and is totally useless. The same applies to the FM and weather bands, which can hear only the strongest signals. Do not bet your life on this device, it will let you down when you need it most.
customer_reviews.author: P. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Decent radio for the money; I will buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: Good evening; this radio doesn't have all the bells and whistles of some others, but it receives well with a much better quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Scarecrow

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Radio. Does not work unless you are holding ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible Radio. Does not work unless you are holding it in your hand and keep the tip of the antenna pointed to a certain direction. Have used this in the city,rural areas, and in adirondack mountains camping. Works horribly in all three scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio. Tough and pick up great . Not real loud but enough for playing near you .
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: For what it costs it's a good value...Seams built well...FM has good selectivity better than most...AM is lousy same as most...WX picks up better than most...Audio quality is poor same as most...So it's a better deal than most other cheep radios...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First one quit within a month
customer_reviews.text: I really like this weather radio ---I live somewhere (Iowa) that I NEED To listen to NOAA daily between tornadoes in spring and snow/ice in Winter.....I have 5 or 6 weather radios around the place in different buildings on the farm ...but I wanted a portable and have tried 2 others that didn't get it done well. This one did and I was pleased as punch as I had AM/FM as well.....then it quit working ( the screen did - which made it useless) so I contacted LaCrosse and asked for a repair and they sent me a brand new one immediately which works perfectly. Lightweight. Powerful enough. Rugged. Versatile. I am satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Mule Farm

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Hurricane Preparedness Kit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little weather radio. Great for small storage and runs on 3 AA batteries. Will be great for camping and hurricanes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good radio and all, one complaint
customer_reviews.text: It's a good radio and gets very good reception. The volume is decent and the sound is decent given that it's a small, portable, emergency radio. The flashlight is OK but not terribly bright ... maybe 30 lumens? My one complaint is that the audio out, 3.5 mm jack, is really low powered. If you plug it in to an external, powered, speaker the volume is really low even when you have the volume on both devices cranked to maximum. My 3.5 mm cable is top quality and the speaker I am plugging it in to can normally get fairly loud. So it's a limitation of the radio.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel D. Self

customer_reviews.title: Got this as a present for my boyfriend. He ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a present for my boyfriend. He loves it! He turns it on EVERY morning to check the weather! We take it on vacations too!
customer_reviews.author: Ms

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome little radio for the boat or when your working outside
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: I woks beautifully
customer_reviews.text: Just as what I was hopping. So far very good i will check how long batteries batteries last
customer_reviews.author: Lolita bonita

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. Perfect for tracking weather for hunting.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Great little camping radio.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camping radio. Speaker is better than I thought. Simple, durable design.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in Chicago

customer_reviews.title: This is a great radio. I used it for 6-8 hours at ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great radio. I used it for 6-8 hours at a time for 20+ days without having to change the batteries. The speaker sounds great and the weather radio is simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E.

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have one.
customer_reviews.text: We have used this frequently this summer. Find it very reliable and portable.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.author: MIKE TAYLOR

customer_reviews.title: Not for Camping in Country
customer_reviews.text: My first camping trip post purchase was in the Mark Twain National Forest in Missouri. I had printed out the NOAA Stations for the area I was traveling to and knew exactly which Weather Channel to turn to. Only this radio would not receive the signal clearly. There was a tornado in the area that our Verizon cell phones alerted us to. This radio was worthless as if it wont tune to and you can not hear the NOAA Station whats the point in a weather radio. I even tried it the next day in clear skies. This weather radio should not be relied on if you are camping in even a semi-rural area based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: S. McLean

product_meta.title: La Crosse 810-805 NOAA/AM/FM Weather RED Alert Super Sport Radio with Flashlight
product_meta.description: Be ahead of the weather with La Crosse's Sporty designed weather radio. Rugged frame for active portability and bonus features. Instantly alerts with NOAA weather band channels and LED backlight change. LED backlight & Red alert indicator at the top of the radio warns you. Tune to its high-quality digital radio with USA-MADE IC chip! Use the included lanyard to the anchor shaft at the bottom of the radio for carrying. Uses 3 AA batteries (not included. )
feature_bullets: Automatically activates when severe weather or other emergencies threaten your local area
Blue backlight changes to red, LED light changes RED and flashes during alerts
AM/FM radio reception with high quality digital IC chip
Requires 3 AA batteries (not included) or, optional 6. 0V AC adapter (sold separately)
